page.title: 06Farming in Thame
page.content: There are many farms in the Thame area and farming is an important part of many peoples lives. One of the farms we visited was Park Meadow Farm. It is typical of the farms in our area. Mr. Holland, the farmer there, has five children: three boys and two girls. Two of the boys work at Scotsgrove, and the other has emigrated to New Zealand. The farmhouse was built by the family in 1952. The orchard was formed two years earlier. The family used to own a dairy but it had to be shut down. The family now makes their living from sheep, cattle and corn. Mr. Holland owns 224 sheep, 273 cattle and a few chickens etc. In addition he has 350 acres of corn and 260 acres of grassland. Many farmers are worried about the closure of Thame cattle market.
